By B Campbell on Monday, September 11, 2000 - 06:10 pm:

Just wanted to say hello and great job to everyone who has kept this going for all this time! I haven't played MR2 in a long time, but there are obviously some real fanatics here.

For me, most of my time is consumed with work and school, but I get a chance to play Gran Turismo 2 and Dragon Warrior Monsters every now and then.

Keep up the good work!

By Nate Railsback on Tuesday, September 12, 2000 - 04:33 pm:

Heya, B!

To Pezcat: Dragon Warrior Monsters is like a cross between DW and Pokemon. If you really, really, really like either (or both) of those games, then it could be a good investment. Some of my friends have become absolutely enthralled with this game. But for some reason, even though I love both component games...something just failed to keep my interest after about 6 hours or so. I think I made the same mistake I made with my first game of Pokemon- trying to raise everything I find. Unfortunately, this game FORCES you to raise tons of monsters, even more than Monster Rancher, and with monsters that are far less "developed" than MR's. Maybe, someday, I'll go back to it.

....Nah, I'll just replay Pokemon and Chrono Trigger (character designs by Akira Toriyama, DW's lead artist).

By Dark Phoenix on Tuesday, September 12, 2000 - 09:41 pm:

Just another note, Akira Toriyama is also the main artist for Dragonball Z. Just look at Crono's portrait in Chrono Trigger and compare it to pictures of Goku and you'll see the similarities.


Welcome back B. Wondering what happened to you:)
